com.tibbo.aggregate.common.context

Interface ContextManager<T extends Context>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ServerContextManager<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultContextManager, RemoteContextManager

    public interface ContextManager<T extends Context>

    • Method Detail

      • isStarted

        boolean isStarted()
        Returns true if context manager startup was completed

      • start

        void start()
        Starts event dispatcher thread

      • restart

        void restart()
        Calls stop() and then start()

      • stop

        void stop()
        1. Stops the event dispatcher
        2. Calls stop() of root context

      • getRoot

        T getRoot()
        Get root context.
        Returns:
        Root context of the managed context tree

      • get

        T get(java.lang.String contextName,
      CallerController caller)
        Get specified context using specified CallerController for permission checking. Note: getting contexts via context manager should not be used in distributed environment. Use Context.get(String, CallerController) method of a "reference" context instead to ensure proper paths conversion.
        Parameters:
        caller - CallerController used for permission checking
        contextName - Context full name
        Returns:
        Requested context or null if this context not exist or not available with current permissions

      • get

        T get(java.lang.String contextName)
        Get specifies context without CallerController. Internally calls get(null, contextName); Note: getting contexts via context manager should not be used in distributed environment. Use Context.get(String) method of a "reference" context instead to ensure proper paths conversion.
        Parameters:
        contextName - Context full name
        Returns:
        Requested context or null if this context not exist or not available with current permissions

      • addMaskEventListener

        void addMaskEventListener(java.lang.String mask,
                          java.lang.String event,
                          ContextEventListener listener)
        Adds event listener to specified event to every context satisfying context mask.

      • addMaskEventListener

        void addMaskEventListener(java.lang.String mask,
                          java.lang.String event,
                          ContextEventListener listener,
                          boolean weak)
        Adds event listener to specified event to every context satisfying context mask.

      • removeMaskEventListener

        void removeMaskEventListener(java.lang.String mask,
                             java.lang.String event,
                             ContextEventListener listener)
        Removes event listener of event 'event' from every context satisfying event mask.

      • getExecutorService

        java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService getExecutorService()
        Returns context manager's task execution service

      • getPluginDirector

        <P extends PluginDirector> P getPluginDirector()
        Returns the plugin director or null if a context manager is not the server context manager.

      • getCallerController

        CallerController getCallerController()
        Returns caller controller used by context manager for internal operations. This controller is unsafe since it doesn't perform any permission checking.

      • getEventQueueLength

        int getEventQueueLength()
        Returns current length of event queue.

      • getEventsScheduled

        long getEventsScheduled()
        Returns number of events received since server start.

      • getEventsProcessed

        long getEventsProcessed()
        Returns number of events processed since server start.

      • getEventQueueStatistics

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> getEventQueueStatistics()
        Returns pending event count per context

      • getFormatCache

        default java.util.Optional<FormatCache> getFormatCache()
        Returns:
        format cache associated with the context. This may be the server-wide cache, a local one or even nothing (denoted by an empty optional) in case of cache absence.

      • getScope

        @Nullable
default java.lang.String getScope()
        The scope of the context manager is for observability purposes only. It helps to reliably distinguish likely-named contexts belonging to different scopes of a low-code application, e.g. the root context of the system tree (named "") and the context of the root panel of a web dashboard (also named "").
        Returns:
        this manager's scope to ease tracing of its contexts or null if the scope is not defined (yet)
